page.title: 15PETERSFIELD - EDUCATION
page.content: {SOUTHERN OUTSKIRTS-PETERSFIELD SCHOOL: This school, built between the A3 and the Cranford Road Estate is an 11-18 years Comprehensive School. It is reducing in size, having been about 1200 pupils on roll a few years ago, it is now only 794 (Sept. 1985). These reduced numbers make it difficult to maintain a sixth form especially as it is in competition with a number of Sixth Form Colleges and Further Education Colleges. It has 82 sixth formers (Sept. 1985) and has achieved a good reputation for examination success. The school has good facilities including a sports hall, workshops, science laboratories and a rural studies centre. It has a strong musical tradition. In spite of the reduction in staff new courses are being introduced which include Information Technology, TVEI and CPVE.
